SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Mrs. Katherine Mozer

2. Your address:

3. Date: March 19, 1962

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): In a little village of 33 houses in Russia near Odessa, Russia.

5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Lucas Vogt - farmer, rented his land. He was not very successful with his crops.

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): November 25, 1902, to Piapot, Saskatchewan.

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.: Spent winter in Piapot, then moved to the farm at Odessa, 2-3 miles out. Spent all my spare time until I was married. Farm to stay throughout my life.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.): 11½ years.

9. What were your reasons for coming West?: We started over in Russia. My father had been old enough to go, rather than send my to fight. He decided to come to Canada.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?): We had our oldest brother living in Canada at Piapot, for 4 years. He was always writing back home telling us to come over! Dad decided to come, brought whole family, then we all moved to Odessa to farm, oldest brother too.

11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   They thought it was a good idea, some came later.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   Our whole family, several other friends with their families.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   By horse (or horse) our friend drove us.
   Then took train to ocean. Boat across.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   Took a whole month by sea, 6 days in ocean with train to Qu'Appelle first stop. Many farms, saw the cities of course not very big then.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   Qu'Appelle

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   Edson (my family settled here, I moved at after our)

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   Farming.

19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   Once a month my father wrote home.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
   William Moser, Adessa, 1910.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?
   Dad's brother-in-law started out but died while crossing.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.
   All came together. Only oldest brother came by himself.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
   Hardships were one of the most noted. Crops sometimes were good, sometimes first came too soon, and sometimes the coming of the railway through Odessa, Vickers, Kendal. Railroad stations were put up about every 7 miles. Once my oldest brother took a load of hay to store barn in Indian Head for exchange for money to buy groceries. When he got there they didn't want any more. Rather than bring it back, he unloaded it. Finally a man paid him $2.50 for it. Out of this he bought a chicken, a bag of flour, 1/4 lb. of coffee, tea. That was our groceries for two weeks. This happened in January. We rarely froze during the winter.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
   Only to church & Butler (Sask.) & shopping at Indian Head & Assiniboia every week. Sometimes, 2 weeks in winter took a load of hay to town for exchange for groceries.

25. When was the first car used in the community?
   1909 - Everyone called it a fire wagon (26 years ago).

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?
   My brother bought me about a year after I was married.

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?
   Indian Head and Qu'Appelle
   26 miles

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)
   Once Odessa was established and the first little grocery store, post office were built we traded there. Only went to Indian Head when we sold our hay.

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   Only bought groceries, nothing else. Could only send clothes, hay for exchange. Never had money.

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?
   Right from the beginning everyone worked all week then Saturday they went to town to buy their groceries.

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.
   In 1920.
   My father bought me a coat for $7.00. My first purchase from mail order. This was after I was married.
   Never ordered too much from mail order. Bought material in our store. Did my own sewing. Besides mail order was cash. In our store we could buy on time.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?
   Odessa district about 1918.

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   Yes.
